snippet: In testimony to Congress, Janet Yellen, the Federal Reserve chairwoman, gave no sign that policy makers were concerned about recent weak economic data.
abstract: Federal Reserve chairwoman Janet L Yellen, during six-hour testimony, tells House Financial Services Committee that she plans to continue policies adopted under Ben S Bernanke; at same time, in emphasizing her concern about unemployment, Yellen also begins process of imposing her own influence on Fed's direction, suggesting that agency may continue to keep short-term interest rates at very low levels.
lead_paragraph: In testimony to Congress, Janet Yellen, the Federal Reserve chairwoman, gave no sign that policy makers were concerned about recent weak economic data.

headline.main: Yellen Sets a Familiar Direction for the Fed
headline.print_headline: Yellen Sets a Familiar Direction for the Fed
